relation: There are no fraternities or sororities at Maryville.
Different organizations on campus are constantly planning events throughout the week, weekends, and nights on campus. Attend what sounds interesting- you'll make friends and have fun!
Excellent food in Gander Dining Hall.
All but the 3rd floor of Mouton Hall are co-ed floors.
The classes are hard, but as long as you study you will pass. Professors are always available via email or by appointment for help.
Bring rain boots! Prepare to study hard.

Rigorous academics with helpful professors and small class sizes (10-30 students). Safe and relatively small campus, with lots of activities. Everyone and everything here is for the students' benefit.
pageTitle: Maryville University of Saint Louis Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex

textAfterTable: Categories Comments Great for these types of students -People who like to have some really close friends, not tons of semi-close friends. -Both partiers and non-partiers alike. -People who like to be involved. There are plenty of clubs who need members. -People who love sports. There is so much team spirit. Intramurals are a blast too! Tips for prospective students -Expect change from yourself. Change isn't always a bad thing. -Stay open-minded about everything. There is so much to explore. -Don't forget to eat and sleep. Believe it or not, it's important. -Have fun. Time goes by much too fast. Bang for the buck I won't lie, it's expensive, but which college isn't. College is like food. I don't mind paying a lot for it if the quality is good. Am enjoying being here I have never been happier. I made friends within the first day I was on campus and those same people are still my best friends. I consider Maryville my home now. When I go back to my real home, I miss school so much. Am learning a lot Maryville has helped me figure out who
